result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Camren M. Johnson

records.addlTxt:
1:33 PM Attorney Drew Lehman in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Camren M. Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court for Camren M. Johnson. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Bond motion filed by Attorney Detert. Arguments heard. Court denies bond motion for reasons set forth on the record. Attorney Detert advises the Court that he has a CD that proves the DE's alibi, but has not provided that to the State. Discussion held. Court orders Attorney Detert to provide a copy of the CD to the State by the end of this week. Attorney Detert is still requesting this matter be set on jury trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury selection scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

09:00 AM   State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Defendant, Camren M. Johnson, appeared in custody with Attorney Eugene E. Detert.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance. Attorney Detert states the matter is not resolved and that he has not received a response to the notice of alibi he has filed. The State advises the Court that this case was in Branch 2 and due to judicial rotation was just transferred to this court. Court adjourns. Attorney Detert also requests a date for the bond motion he filed yesterday.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion To Modify Bond
Notice of Alibi
ROTATION
Judicial Pretrial - in court on August 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Due to congestion in the calendar the JPTC of 07/27/22 at 10:30 has been reset to 08/17/22 at 9:00.
Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Detert.   Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Detert's bond motion. Court denies bond motion. Bond cont.
Motion hearing on June 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on July 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on July 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
With Camren/Attorney Detert a MH has been set to 06/29/22 at 2:00 and the JPTC has been adjourned to 07/27/22 at 10:30
Due to an ongoing trial in br 2 the JPTC of 06/17/22 at 10:00 has been adjoured with Attorney Detert to 07/27/22 at 10:30 with a MH on 06/29/22 at 2:00.
Motion To Modify Bond
Submitted by Atty Eugene Detert

Defendant, Camren M. Johnson, appeared with Attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  ST called witness KPD Ofc Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Detert. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Branch 2 Scheduling Order given to attorney.   Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Atty Eugene Detert

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Alarum W, Richard T, or GRT.

03:24 PM   Deputy District Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Toni Young.  Clerk: P.Trossen.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am. $30000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  sg
and witness list filed by the State
